edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.and

Class SigmaANDProverComputation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.and.SigmaANDProverComputation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SigmaProverComputation

    public class SigmaANDProverComputation
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaProverComputation
    Concrete implementation of Sigma Protocol prover computation.

    This protocol is used for a prover to convince a verifier that the AND of any number of statements are true, where each statement can be proven by an associated Sigma protocol.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 1.14 of pseudo codes document at http://cryptobiu.github.io/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SigmaANDProverComputation

        public SigmaANDProverComputation(java.util.ArrayList<SigmaProverComputation> provers,
                         int t,
                         java.security.SecureRandom random)
        Constructor that sets the underlying provers.
        Parameters:
        provers - array of SigmaProverComputation, where each object represent a statement and the prover wants to prove to the verify that the AND of all statements are true.
        t - soundness parameter. t MUST be equal to all t values of the underlying provers object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given t is not equal to all t values of the underlying provers object.

      • computeFirstMsg

        public SigmaProtocolMsg computeFirstMsg(SigmaProverInput in)
        Computes the first message the protocol.

        "COMPUTE all first prover messages a1,...,am".

        Specified by:
        computeFirstMsg in interface SigmaProverComputation
        Parameters:
        input - MUST be an instance of SigmaANDInput.
        Returns:
        SigmaMultipleMsg contains a1, ..., am.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is not an instance of SigmaANDInput.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of given inputs is different from the number of underlying provers.
